def: A minute arachnid, of the order Acarina, of which there aremany species; as, the cheese mite, sugar mite, harvest mite, etc. SeeAcarina.
A quilted military doublet or gambeson worn in the 14th and15th centuries; also, a name for the doublet of the 16th and 17thcenturies worn by civilians.
The history or description of the sacred writings or of sacredpersons; a narrative of the lives of the saints; a catalogue ofsaints. J. H. Newman.
That mode of treating diseases, by which a morbid condition isremoved by inducing an opposite morbid condition to supplant it;allopathy.
A plant of several species of the genus Chrysocoma; -- socalled from the tufts of yellow flowers which terminate the stems;also, the Ranunculus auricomus, a kind of buttercup.
Showy in dress; attentive to dress.A dressy flaunting maidservant. T. Hook.A neat, dressy gentleman in black. W. Irving.
A blinder on a horse's bridle.
A salt of a hypothetical thallic acid.
The property of radiant energy (found chiefly in solar orelectric light) by which chemical changes are produced, as inphotography.
To consign beforehand; to make a previous consignment of.
To examine beforehand, as witnesses or evidence.A committee of nine precognoscing the chances. Masson.
